page.title: 06EDUCATION BILLINGSHURST
page.content: ST MARY'S PLAYGROUP HELD AT THE CHURCH CENTRE, EAST STREET PROVIDES PRE-SCHOOL EDUCATION FOR 12 CHILDREN, AND A SECOND GROUP AT COPPED HALL ROAD TAKES 25.INGFIELD MANOR RUN BY THE SPASTICS SOCIETY GIVES RESIDENTIAL CARE TERMLY FOR 75 CHILDREN, AGED 2-17 WITH CEREBRAL PALSY RELATED DISABILITIES. THE UNIQUE PETO UNIT DEVELOPS PUPIL'S INDIVIDUAL ABILITIES MAKING THEM AS INDEPENDANT AS POSSIBLE FACILITIES INCLUDE FULLY EQUIPPED CLASSROOMS AND SWIMMING POOL.MEDICAL STAFF AND RESIDENTIAL HOUSE-PARENTS PROVIDE A STABLE,CARING ENVIRONMENT AND TEACHERS HELPED BY CLASSROOM AIDES TEACH A VARIED CURRICULUM OF CRAFT AND ACADEMIC SUBJECTS AS SUITED TO EACH PUPIL'S POTENTIAL ABILITY.FEES FOR MOST PUPILS PAID BY LOCAL AUTHORITY.
